title: Maintenance Technician
description:
Description:

We are seeking a dedicated and skilled **Maintenance Technician** to join our team and ensure smooth operation and upkeep for GMHC. The ideal candidate will be responsible for performing routine maintenance tasks, addressing repair needs, and ensuring the building is safe, clean, and functional for all occupants.

**Essential Job Functions**


The following duties are mandatory requirements of the position:

* **Perform Comprehensive Repairs and Maintenance**: Demonstrate expertise in all aspects of commercial building upkeep, including plumbing, electrical work, flooring, lighting, painting, spackling, lock repairs, and cleaning & sanitizing.
* **Ensure Compliance**: Adhere to health, safety, and building codes and regulations.
* **Maintain Cleanliness**: Keep common areas such as lobbies, restrooms, and break rooms clean and organized.
* **Conduct Preventive Maintenance**: Carry out routine maintenance on equipment and building systems to reduce downtime and extend their lifespan.
* **Use Tools and Ladders Safely**: Operate power tools and use ladders following established safety procedures.
* **Assist with Office Operations**: Support staff with daily office tasks, including office moves and relocations.
* **Complete Documentation**: Fill out reports, including incident and work sheets, both electronically (via tablet or PC) and manually.
* **Manage Work Orders**: Collect daily work orders and acquire necessary supplies before attending to service calls.
* **Participate in Fire Brigade**: Join the building’s fire brigade, receiving training from GMHC-authorized personnel to aid in fire safety and tenant support.
* **Handle Extermination and Vermin Control**: Address pest issues and escalate to building management when necessary.

**Other Responsibilities**


The following duties are assigned by the supervisor:

* **Coordinate with Facilities Manager**: Collaborate on larger projects and major repairs as needed.
* **Adhere to Protocol**: Follow repair procedures outlined in the GMHC Property and Maintenance Manual.
* **Assist with Reporting**: Support the manager in preparing monthly reports, Data Driven Administrative Supervision, dashboards, and contributing to quality improvement efforts.
* **Manage Supplies**: Maintain inventory of maintenance supplies and tools, ensuring vans are consistently stocked.
* **Understand MSDS Sheets**: Be knowledgeable about Material Safety Data Sheets (MSDS) and the proper use and application of chemicals.
* **Practice Safety**: Always use universal precautions and adhere to safety measures, supporting other team members as needed.
* **Report Issues**: Observe building conditions and promptly report any issues, hazards (such as fire or trip hazards), and concerns to the supervisor.
* **Work Environment**: Perform duties primarily indoors, with occasional exposure to outdoor elements when inspecting or repairing external features.
* **Emergency Response**: Be available for emergency response 24/7 and be prepared for occasional evening or weekend work for urgent repairs or scheduled maintenance.
* **Physical Requirements**: Capable of lifting 50 to 60 pounds or more.
* **Onsite Duties**: Carry out all tasks onsite, with limited offsite responsibilities as assigned by the supervisor.


Requirements:
**Special Skills and Knowledge**


The ideal candidate should possess most or all of the following skills and knowledge, in addition to the job responsibilities and educational requirements listed:

* **Technical Experience**: Proficiency in janitorial tasks, cleaning with chemicals, sanitizing, plumbing, electrical work, painting, spackling, locksmithing, flooring types, and general maintenance.
* **Self-Motivation**: Ability to work independently with minimal supervision, demonstrating reliability and punctuality.
* **Problem-Solving**: Strong problem-solving skills and the ability to troubleshoot issues efficiently.
* **Communication Skills**: Excellent communication abilities, with a professional demeanor when interacting with building occupants and vendors.
* **Technology Proficiency**: Basic computer knowledge, mobile phones and applications, GPS, and tablets for managing work orders and tracking tasks.
* **Organizational Skills**: Ability to manage and track maintenance tasks effectively, ensuring timely closure of work orders.
* **Customer Service**: Demonstrated courtesy, respect, professionalism, and skill in de-escalating and managing stressful situations.
* **Instruction Following**: Capability to listen carefully and execute duties precisely as outlined by GMH and the supervisor.

**Education, Certification, & License**

* **Education**: High School Diploma or equivalent, or sufficient literacy to perform essential job functions.
* **Experience**: Proven experience in all aspects of the job responsibilities outlined above.
* **Driver’s License**: Valid, unexpired driver’s license, to be maintained throughout employment.


GMHC has a host of training relevant to the work we do for compliance and enhance understanding of the work


Of the agency and the population served.

title: Director of Financial Aid
description:
Description:
**Pillar College is New Jersey's only Evangelical Christian College, and we are looking for a Mission aligned, Purpose-driven, Strategic, Professional, Team-builder, who is hands-on and willing to dig in and help build a world-class Financial Aid team, to provide our students with an outstanding experience!**

**If that's you, Apply now!**

**SUMMARY:**


The Director of Financial Aid reports to the Associate Vice President of Enrollment Services (AVPES) to administer various responsibilities and activities that the AVPES initiates or delegates. This person is primarily responsible for executing and overseeing the various policies, procedures, and systems that define the Financial Aid Department. This person interacts primarily with FA Solutions, students, staff, and cooperates with other departments within the college, most importantly (but not exclusively) Student Accounts, Academics, Registrar and the Business Office.

**SUPERVISION:**


Supervision Received**:**


 Immediate Supervision


 General Supervision General Direction Understudy  

Supervision Given**:**


 Coordinates Events & Activities


 Supervises Assistants


 Supervises Department

**WORK PERFORMED:**


A. Be aware of current projects and activities for Financial Aid in coordination with AVPES


B. Be aware of calendar for Financial Aid events, deadlines and goals


C. Assist with interactions with the Dept. of Education COD system, as well as G5 and other government sites, maintaining reconciliation records and interacting with the Pillar College accounting area to track deposits and disbursements alongside vendor FA Solutions.


D. Oversee completion of annual audits by various federal, state and independent agencies


E. Assist FA Solutions with resolving various reconciliation activities including COD and HESAA, or other agencies as needed


F. Review “Pending Charges” in the Anthology Student (AS) to ensure timeliness and accuracy, which includes verifying a) enrollment is accurate and complete, b) charges are calculated correctly, c) charges are dated according to policy and assigned to the proper term


G. Make use of the Anthology Student modules, including Student Verification to ensure accurate setup for Financial Aid tables, disbursement schedules, student emails and many other systems-based aspects of Financial Aid operations in accordance with Financial Aid policies and AVPES priorities


H. Ensure Financial Aid packaging is accomplished in a timely manner according to department policy and practice


I. Create reports, export data from the AS for analysis, formatting and presentation as needed


J. Work with AVPES on projects to support the Financial Aid department, as well as special projects


K. Help administer federal and state financial aid programs


L. Have a strong commitment to student service


M. Establish/maintain a filing system (electronic or physical) for all Financial Aid related materials including student files, COD, G5, HESAA and other Financial Aid related activities and agencies


N. Be available when required for events that may occur outside of regular business hours


O. Coordinate with AVPES regarding staff schedules


P. Administer work schedules for Financial Aid Department employees


Q. Refer personnel issues or problems to AVPES


R. Work with AVPES to identify ways to improve performance and compliance in the Financial Aid area, and implement agreed upon changes in policy or practice


S. Execute and complete tasks assigned by AVPES in a timely manner


Requirements: ***Experience:***

* Member of a team-oriented office staff
* Computer skills on MS Office, including Word, Excel, and PowerPoint
* Experience with Anthology Student preferred
* Proven ability to multi-task in fast paced environment
* Previous Financial Aid experience in New Jersey

***Education:***

* Bachelor’s degree or equivalent
* Familiarity with Federal Financial Aid, and the New Jersey Tuition Aid Grant (TAG) program
* Familiarity with accounting, banking, reconciliation procedures a plus

***Interpersonal Skills:***

* Excellent communication and organizational skills
* Friendly and polite with good phone techniques
* Relates well to other people
* Ability to follow and manage projects from start to finish
* Strong ability to multi-task and set priorities in a team environment
* Exercise judgment to plan, prioritize and execute tasks
* Able to maintain strict confidentiality regarding matters of the Office
* A strong commitment to our Christian education mission
* Participate in enterprise-wide scheduled events and staff meetings

***CHRISTIAN LIFE***

* Commitment to Jesus Christ through new birth experience
* Must have proven Christian character and spiritual maturity.

**Working Conditions:**

* Primary office is at 60 Park Place, Newark, NJ; some events at other instructional sites may require attendance
* Regular interaction with Pillar College staff and students

**Physical Demands:**


80% of time spent sitting at desk using computer and phone; 20% of time standing and walking.

**HOurs:**


Generally Monday through Friday, 40 hours/week.


Occasional evening or Saturday participation may be required

title: Team Lead / Implant Consultant
description:
Description:

Join us at Shared Practices Group, where we're revolutionizing dental care and enhancing lives through our innovative implant solutions, particularly the life-changing All-on-4 dental implants. These revolutionary procedures not only improve health but also boost confidence and self-esteem by providing a stable, natural-looking set of teeth. They improve speech, eating comfort, and overall quality of life, promising a transformative experience for our patients?.

**Your Role in Our Mission:**


As an Implant Sales Consultant, you're not just selling a service; you're providing a pathway to confidence and improved quality of life. With your expertise in consultative B2C high-ticket sales, particularly in healthcare, you'll guide patients through the life-changing journey of dental restoration, offering a solution that significantly impacts their daily lives and long-term health. Your role will involve engaging directly with patients, understanding their needs, and guiding them through the life-changing journey of dental transformation.

**Your Impact:**


You'll lead high-ticket dental implant sales, transforming lives one smile at a time. With your 3-5 years of consultative B2C selling experience, you'll drive growth, foster patient relationships, and navigate the journey from consultation to life-changing treatment.

**What You'll Do:**

* Present our dental implant solutions to patients, including the transformative All-on-4 procedure, while ensuring a comprehensive understanding of their benefits and impact on patients' lives.
* Educate patients on financial options (such as Healthcare Loans, Health Savings Accounts, Flexible Spending Accounts, early 401k access, auto equity loans, and reverse mortgages) to provide tailored financial solutions, ensuring patients can afford the life-changing treatment they need.
* Develop and nurture lasting relationships, guiding patients from initial inquiry to post-treatment care.

**What We Offer:** A competitive compensation of up to $75,000 per year plus potential monthly bonus which could result in an additional 36k per year, full healthcare benefits, and the opportunity to be part of a team that values innovation and patient-centric care. **\\*Base compensation is dependent upon experience\\***

**Hours of Operation:** This is a full-time, exempt role and the hours of operation are Monday through Friday.

**Join Us:** If you're driven by the prospect of making a tangible difference in people's lives and are ready to take your career to new heights, we invite you to apply and help us continue our journey of empowering better lives.


Requirements:
**Qualifications:**

* 3-5 years of consultative B2C selling experience, preferably in healthcare or related fields, preferably high-ticket.
* Proven leadership in sales strategies and customer relationship building.
* Charismatic and insightful, with a natural ability to understand and articulate patient and practice needs.
* Passionate about improving patients' lives through innovative dental solutions.
* Empathetic to the emotional and physical journey of patients undergoing dental transformations.
* Empathetic communicator, adept at building trust and understanding with patients and team members.
* Listens with intent to understand deeper patient needs and practice goals.
* Embraces an Attitude of Gratitude, recognizing team efforts and patient loyalty, fostering a positive work environment.
* Dedicated to Constant Improvement, seeking out new knowledge and methodologies to enhance patient care and sales processes.
* Exhibits a strong Sense of Ownership, taking responsibility for the success of both sales targets and patient satisfaction.
* Puts the team's needs first, adhering to the principle of Serve Your Team FIRST, ensuring collaborative success and support.
* Communicates with Compassionate Clarity, ensuring transparency and understanding in all interactions with patients and team members.
* Strives to Create Raving Fans, understanding that exceptional patient experiences are the key to the practice's success.
* Navigating complex sales cycles with the tenacity and grit required for high-ticket sales.
* Finding a balance between personalized patient care and scalable business growth.

title: Head Stock Clerk
description:
**Position Details**
--------------------


Position Information
**Recruitment/Posting Title** Head Stock Clerk
  

**Job Category** Staff & Executive - Finance/Accounting/Purchasing
  

**Department** RSDM-Admin & Finance
  

**Overview**
New Jersey’s academic health center, Rutgers Biomedical and Health Sciences (RBHS) takes an integrated approach to educating students, providing clinical care, and conducting research, all with the goal of improving human health. Aligned with Rutgers University–New Brunswick and collaborating university wide, RBHS includes eight schools, a behavioral health network, and five centers and institutes that focus on cancer treatment and research, neuroscience, advanced biotechnology and medicine, environmental and occupational health, and health care policy and aging research.
Our faculty are teachers, clinicians, and scientists with unparalleled experience who advance medical innovation and provide patient care informed by the latest research findings. We offer an outstanding education in medicine, dentistry, pharmacy, public health, nursing, biomedical research, and the full spectrum of allied health careers.
Our clinical and academic facilities are located throughout the state—at Rutgers University–New Brunswick, including Piscataway; and at locations in Newark, Scotch Plains, Somerset, Stratford, and other locations. Clinical partners include Robert Wood Johnson University Hospital in New Brunswick, Newark’s University Hospital in Newark, and other affiliates.
Through this community of healers, scientists, and scholars, Rutgers is equipped as never before to transform lives.
  

**Posting Summary**
Rutgers School of Dental Medicine (RSDM) is seeking a Head Stock Clerk for the Office of Finance – Dental Store Facility. Under the direction of the Manager, Dental Store, the Head Stock Clerk will receive storeroom merchandise, maintain inventories of disposable supplies, make deliveries of dental supplies and maintain the storeroom in a safe and clean condition.  

  

Essential duties and responsibilities include the following:* Receives and delivers supplies and equipment throughout the Dental School including the pre-clinic.
* Verifies contents of packages to the packing slips and enters into the WebOps Inventory System.
* Responsible for set-up and delivery of dental supplies and equipment for student kit distribution.
* Ships return items via UPS, bring returns to the loading dock, and maintain receipts.
* Notifies Dental Store buyer of low inventory levels.
* Fills orders for disposable items from inventory.
* Prepares for and participate in the annual physical inventory.
* Assists Dental Store Buyer with over the counter merchandise sales of dental supplies to students, faculty and staff in the Dental Store.
* Performs other related duties as assigned.

  

**Position Status** Full Time
  

**Hours Per Week**
  

**Daily Work Shift** Day
  

**Work Arrangement**
  

**FLSA** Nonexempt
  

**Grade** 1475
  

**Position Salary**
  

**Annual Minimum Salary** 19.800
  

**Annual Mid Range Salary** 20.300
  

**Annual Maximum Salary** 20.910
  

**Standard Hours** 35.00
  

**Union Description** Teamsters, Local 97
  

**Payroll Designation** PeopleSoft
  

**Benefits**
Rutgers offers a comprehensive benefit program to eligible employees. For details, please go to http://uhr.rutgers.edu/benefits/benefits-overview.  

Rutgers also offers a benefit program to eligible full-time postdoctoral fellow students. For details, please go to https://finance.rutgers.edu/healthcare-risk/insurance/postdoctoral-health-insurance.  

  

**Seniority Unit**
  

**Terms of Appointment** Staff - 12 month
  

**Position Pension Eligibility** PERS
  

Qualifications
**Minimum Education and Experience**
* High school diploma or equivalent.
* One (1) year of experience in Receiving and or Supply center environment including experience in receiving, sorting and distribution of supplies.


  

**Certifications/Licenses**
  

**Required Knowledge, Skills, and Abilities**
* Basic to intermediate communication skills (both written and verbal); basic to intermediate computer skills (MS Word, Excel and Outlook); basic math and reading skills.
* Strong customer service skills and attention to detail.
* Must work well with students, faculty and staff.


  

**Preferred Qualifications**
* Inventory software experience desirable.


  

**Equipment Utilized**
  

**Physical Demands and Work Environment**
* Ability to lift up to 70lbs.


  

**Special Conditions**
  

Posting Details
**Posting Number** 23ST2968
  

**Posting Open Date**
  

**Special Instructions to Applicants**
  

**Regional Campus** Rutgers Biomedical and Health Sciences (RBHS)
  

**Home Location Campus** Newark (RBHS)
  

**City** Newark
  

**State** NJ
  

**Location Details**
  

Pre-employment Screenings
All offers of employment are contingent upon successful completion of all pre-employment screenings.
Immunization Requirements
Under Policy 100.3.1 Immunization Policy for Covered Individuals, if employment will commence during Flu Season, Rutgers University may require certain prospective employees to provide proof that they are vaccinated against Seasonal Influenza for the current Flu Season, unless the University has granted the individual a medical or religious exemption. Additional infection control and safety policies may apply. Prospective employees should speak with their hiring manager to determine which policies apply to the role or position for which they are applying. Failure to provide proof of vaccination for any required vaccines or obtain a medical or religious exemption from the University will result in rescission of a candidate’s offer of employment or disciplinary action up to and including termination.

title: Automotive Sales Consultant Nissan
description:
**Job Description**
-------------------


Empire Automotive Group Nissan of Hillside NJ:***Sales Consultant***


It's an exciting time to work for Nissan with their wide-ranging lineup of models! We are seeking candidates at all levels of sales experience to join our expanding team. Hillside Nissan has a great opportunity for anyone looking for a friendly work environment that supports a work/life balance while still making a rewarding pay.

**Your Daily Work Schedule:**

* Maintain a strong knowledge base of all new vehicle makes and models.
* Interact and consult with customers to guide them through their vehicle purchase.
* Create the best vehicle-buying experience to make lifelong customers.
* Test drive vehicles to demonstrate automotive features.
* You will make daily phone calls, follow up with existing and potential customers to generate appointments and close sales.
* You will reach out to customers to make sure they have had an exceptional experience at the dealership.

 ***Some Empire sales consultants earn over $100,000 by the end of their first year!***

**Qualities we’re looking for**:

* Reliable, self-starter mentality and ambitious spirit.
* Ready to waste no time on learning new product ins and outs; eager to improve.
* Professional, well-groomed personal appearance
* You have experience providing outstanding customer service by showcasing expertise, fostering trust, and growing customer satisfaction.
* You have excellent communication, interpersonal, and organizational skills.
* You understand the importance of listening and being empathetic.
* You have strong work-ethic with the ability to work in a fast-paced, results-driven environment.
* You have at least one year of prior employment effectively communicating with customers face-to-face or telephone contact.
* You have friendliness, enthusiasm, reliability, with a positive "team-player" attitude.
* You are open to constructive feedback to improve your performance and development.
* Clean driving record and valid driver’s license
* You have strong computer and multitasking skills using various provided computer programs as selling tools.
* You will operate a clean, organized, presentable workplace with a strong attention to details.
* Protecting customer’s information while collecting and transcribing data in order to complete paperwork.

 ***The job descriptions and responsibilities above will be required but not limited to any other job-related duties assigned by their supervisor. In a retail automotive dealership, nothing is more important than a satisfied customer. Come grow with us!***

*We are an equal-opportunity employer and prohibit discrimination/harassment without regard to race, color, religion, age, sex, national origin, disability status, genetics, protected veteran status, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, or any other characteristic protected by federal, state or local laws.*

**Company Description**
-----------------------


The Empire Automotive Group provides exceptional opportunities for any individual seeking to advance in the retail automotive industry. Empire has numerous franchise operations throughout Nassau, Suffolk, Queens, Brooklyn, Westchester and New Jersey, featuring 18 different brands, both import and domestic. We are the third-fastest growing privately owned automotive group in the U.S.


At the Empire Automotive Group, we are passionate about shaping the future of mobility. We go beyond selling and servicing vehicles; we provide unparalleled experiences with knowledge and skills that redefine industry standards. Our commitment to respect, transparency, and integrity forms the foundation of our operation. Not only do we create meaningful customer relationships, but we also nurture strong community connections. As one team, we work to re-imagine the automotive industry, while ensuring that all drivers continue their journey forward. Come grow with us!

**Benefits**
------------


  401k Plan


 Paid time off (PTO)


 Competitive Pay Plans


 Health Insurance


 Dental Insurance


 Vision Plans


 Promotion from within

title: Automotive Sales Receptionist Hyundai
description:
**Job Description**
-------------------


The Empire Automotive Group Hyundai of New Rochelle dealership is seeking a Receptionist Cashier, a dedicated professional with strong interpersonal skills who shares our company’s passion for excellence. If you have job experience in which your most important objective was a satisfied customer, this may be the perfect career move for you.


At Empire, our goal is to create a positive and inclusive workplace that promotes excellence and achievement, and we strive to provide the very best experience for our customers. Come join one of the fastest growing auto dealerships in the U.S., in a position where you will have the opportunity to grow.


Your daily work schedule:

* You will answer incoming calls and greet customers in a professional manner.
* You will review all appointments for the current business day confirming appointments or rescheduling, including completing daily phone activities.
* You will manage and organize incoming concerns from customers informing management when necessary.
* You will ensure that a valid form of payment has been taken and authorized for appropriate amount and completing daily reports.
* You will handle customer concerns, provide appropriate solutions and alternatives within reasonable time limits using dealership’s CRM, phone, text and email.
* You will develop a trusting relationship with all customers and fellow employees.
* You will maintain accurate and complete information about any customer concerns, tracking progress until completion.
* You will take extra steps to engage customers when a need is detected, often before you are asked to do so.
* You will work with other dealership personnel to resolve any customer questions or concerns.
* You will develop a fluent understanding of the automotive manufacturer’s standards for customer satisfaction.

 *We have created a dealer culture that’s inviting to all our employees, empowering them to be successful in their roles. The Sales Receptionist is one of the most important parts of the sales team; furthering the assistance of creating a positive car buying experience!*


 Qualities we are looking for:

* You have excellent communication, interpersonal, and organizational skills.
* Reliable and presentable in business attire representing Empire in a professional manner.
* You understand the importance of listening and being empathetic.
* You have strong work-ethic with the ability to work in a fast-paced, results-driven environment.
* You have experience providing outstanding customer service by showcasing expertise, fostering trust, and growing customer satisfaction.
* You have at least one year of prior employment involving customer facing service or telephone contact.
* You have friendliness, enthusiasm, reliability, with a positive "team-player" attitude.
* You are open to constructive feedback to improve your performance and development.
* Flexible with work scheduling and availability to work weekends and holidays.
* You have strong computer and multi-tasking skills, which includes Microsoft Office.
* You will operate a clean, organized, presentable workplace with a strong attention to details.

 *The job descriptions and responsibilities above will be required but not limited to any other job-related duties assigned by their supervisor. In a retail automotive dealership, nothing is more important than a satisfied customer. Come grow with us!*

title: Underwriting Specialist, Trade Credit
description:
Underwriting Specialist - Trade Credit
  
  

This Underwriting Specialist role will be an ideal next step in your career if you already have some relevant experience in insurance.
  
  

Make your mark in Underwriting
  
  

AIG underwriting teams help to find insurance solutions in areas including Financial Lines, Property, Casualty, Specialty Lines, Cyber, Multinational Clients, and High Net Worth individuals. We are reimagining how we help customers to manage risk, transforming our operating model, and reshaping our role responsibilities and career pathways. The goal is to unlock the full potential in each colleague – empowering our people to grow as insurance professionals and add more value to our customers and AIG.
  
  

The Underwriting Specialist manages key relationships and reviews complex transactions for key targeted Trade Credit brokers/markets/industries. This is an integral position that provides front facing external/internal marketing responsibilities as well as management of office underwriting duties and initiatives within their portfolio.
  
  

The Underwriting Specialist is reporting to the Head of Trade Credit Northeast and Southeast Zones and is responsible for:
  
  

Underwrite and manage a book of business composed of renewals, new business, and manage day to day operations.
  
Drive underwriting excellence establishing and ensuring adherence to risk appetite, line setting (where appropriate), standards and guidelines, and ensure rating and pricing adequacy aligned with regional guidance.
  
Lead and expand relationships with brokers and clients in North America to grow the business unit’s book of trade credit business.
  
Executing on a structured commercial strategy aiming at identifying new business opportunities with broker partners and clients.
  
Underwriting large/complex new credit insurance submissions and negotiating policy terms and conditions.
  
Participating in and completing special projects as required.
  
  

This is an integral position that provides front facing external/internal marketing responsibilities as well as management of office underwriting duties and initiatives within their portfolio.
  
  

**Qualified candidates should have:**  

A proven track record of successfully growing a book of business in the trade credit industry.
  
10+ years of experience in an underwriting capacity preferred
  
Strong commercial/business skills. Solid organizational and communication skills are essential.
  
Strategic leadership skills in developing vision, purpose, and driving for results.
  
Established strong relationships with clients and brokers.
  
MBA preferred. Second language proficiency valued, and underwriting, banking, or other credit analysis experience a plus.
  
Proficiency in software packages Microsoft Office (Excel, Outlook, PowerPoint), Cap IQ, Salesforce, internal credit insurance platforms.
  
  

For positions based in New York City, the base salary range is $91,000 - $111,000. In addition, the position is eligible for a bonus in accordance with the terms of the applicable incentive plan. We’re proud to offer a range of competitive benefits, a summary of which can be viewed here: AIG Benefits Overview.
  
  

#LI-AR1
  
  

Enjoy benefits that take care of what matters
  
  

At AIG, our people are our greatest asset. We know how important it is to protect and invest in what’s most important to you. That is why we created our Total Rewards Program, a comprehensive benefits package that extends beyond time spent at work to offer benefits focused on your health, wellbeing and financial security—as well as your professional development—to bring peace of mind to you and your family.
  
  

Reimagining insurance to make a bigger difference to the world
  
  

American International Group, Inc. (AIG) is a global leader in commercial and personal insurance solutions; we are one of the world’s most far-reaching property casualty networks. It is an exciting time to join us — across our operations, we are thinking in new and innovative ways to deliver ever-better solutions to our customers. At AIG, you can go further to support individuals, businesses, and communities, helping them to manage risk, respond to times of uncertainty and discover new potential. We invest in our largest asset, our people, through continuous learning and development, in a culture that celebrates everyone for who they are and what they want to become.
  
  

Welcome to a culture of belonging
  
  

We’re committed to creating a culture that truly respects and celebrates each other’s talents, backgrounds, cultures, opinions and goals. We foster a culture of inclusion and belonging through our flexible work arrangements, diversity and inclusion learning, cultural awareness activities and Employee Resource Groups (ERGs). With global chapters, ERGs are a cornerstone for our culture of inclusion. title: Health and Wellness Director (RN Required)
description:
Description:
**Job Title:** Health and Wellness Director

**Reports to:** Executive Director

**FLSA Status:** Exempt

**OUR** **MISSION:** We focus on providing genuine hospitality and five-star quality care.

**Position Scope:**


We are seeking a dedicated and experienced Health and Wellness Director to oversee our health and wellness programs and services. As a key member of our team, you will be responsible for creating and implementing health and wellness initiatives to promote the physical, mental, and emotional well-being of our residents. The Health and Wellness Director will work collaboratively with our team to improve overall health and quality of life.


Ensures that CIEL Senior Living standards and state requirements for resident care are met. Directs staff, ensures regulatory compliance and is responsible for the management of the clinical budget.

**RESPONSIBILITIES:**

* Supports the mission, vision and goals of the organization, upholding and promoting company culture and vision.
* Directly oversee the delivery of care to the residents of the community to ensure that emotional, physical, psychological and safety needs are met through all program services and activities.
* Coordinate, along with the Executive Director, family/resident care conferences and serve as a direct liaison between residents, families, and staff. Worth with the residents, families, and other staff to ensure that residents are at appropriate levels of care.
* Manage labor costs, supplies and other line items in the clinical budget.
* Complete weekly, monthly reports as required.
* Monitor documentation systems to ensure that all regulatory timeframes for review of assessments and service plans are met and that resident needs are met. Write and review residents’ assessments/evaluations and care/service-plans with appropriate staff.
* Assess/evaluate potential residents for admission into the community and to determine level of care. This may involve assessing/evaluating potential residents in their home or another healthcare setting; must be able to drive to location and perform assessment/evaluation professionally and timely. Schedule and conduct new resident orientation for residents upon move into the community.
* Provide, plan, schedule and monitor staff training programs and in-services for staff including statutory or regulator required training. Attend all required training, in-service, and staff meetings.
* Manage and coordinate the work of all nursing department/clinical staff of the community, communicating pertinent resident health and safety information. This includes overseeing and/or completing staff schedules at least monthly and daily assignments.
* Strive to maintain a safe working environment through the prevention of accidents, the preservation of equipment, and the achievement of safe working practices.
* Ensure compliance with all state regulatory requirements including mandatory reporting to the State. Ensure that all concern and incident reports are completed, filed and that follow-up in conducted appropriately.
* Assist and/or perform in mock surveys.
* Maintain a positive and professional demeanor toward residents, visitors, families, and co-workers while adhering to all policies, standards, and procedures of the Company.
* Visits residents in hospital/rehab. as assigned.
* Organizes and communicates with leadership, residents, associates and families regarding annual flu clinics, TB testing of associates/residents.
* Participates in community Wellness Programs as assigned.
* Participates in MOD weekend and holiday coverage, as assigned.
* Member of the backup sales team.
* Participates in on-call schedule as assigned.
* Counsels' residents in identifying and resolving social or other problems.
* Requires 24/7 on-call clinical support.
* Perform other duties as assigned.


#CB


Requirements:
**QUALIFICATIONS:**

* Education as required to obtain state nursing license (LPN/LVN or RN). Preferred a minimum of 3 years clinical leadership experience. Working knowledge of basic technology and electronic documentation.
* Ability to demonstrate appropriate judgment skills and independent clinical decisions in routine and emergency resident care matters.
* High level of interpersonal skills to handle sensitive and confidential situations and documentation.
* Ability to work evenings, weekends, and flexible hours when necessary to meet the needs of the residents.
* Excellent verbal, oral, and written communication skills
* Valid driver’s license: ability to travel to conduct resident assessments and required trainings for professional development.
* Must have current RN or LPN licensure in good standing.

**PHYSICAL QUALIFICATIONS:**

* Walk/Stand – must be able to continuously walk and stand.
* Environment Condition – must be able to perform work both inside and outside
* Sit – sit infrequently
* Lift - constantly 0-10 pounds, frequently 11 – 50 pounds, occasionally 51 – 100 pounds
* Carry - constantly 0-10 pounds, frequently 11 – 50 pounds, occasionally 51 – 100 pounds
* Push - constantly 0-10 pounds, frequently 11 – 50 pounds, occasionally 51 – 100 pounds
* Climb – must be able to climb stairs on a frequent basis, with the opportunity to utilize the elevator as an alternate resource if available
* Bend – must be able to bend at the waist, knees, hips and spine on a frequent basis; may require frequently manipulating weights of 25 pounds or more.
* Squat – must be able to squat on a frequent basis to reach below the knee, may require lifting of 50 pounds or less.
* Twist or rotate – must be able to twist or rotate occasionally at the trunk, hips, knees, and neck, manipulating weights of 25 pounds or more.
* Reach– must be able to reach on a frequent basis. May occasionally reach overhead, requiring manipulation of weight of 10 pounds or less, and below waist manipulating weight of 25 pounds or more.
* Sensory Vision – must be able to read clearly with or without corrective lenses
* Hear - Must be able to hear telephone, audible alarms, bells and signals related to resident safety with or without hearing devices.
* Speech/Language – must have strong command of English sufficient to read and write and interpret administration information.

**OUR** **MISSION:** We are united in our mission to offer seniors an elevated way of life, where comfort, connection, and joy thrive.

**POSITION** **SUMMARY**


Perform various resident care activities and related nonprofessional services essential to caring for personal needs and comfort of residents; including routine personal care, recreational programming, housekeeping, and meal service in accordance with company standards and federal, state, and local standards, guidelines, and regulations and as directed.

**RESPONSIBILITIES:**

Health and Wellness Nurse is responsible for providing nursing support as directed by the Health and Wellness Director. Assists to ensure that Ciel Senior Living standards and state requirements for resident care are met. Assists with managing staff and helps to ensure regulatory compliance

**RESPONSIBILITIES:**

title: Truck Loader - Melville, NY
description:
Description: **Hadco Metal Trading Co., LLC** distributes and supplies metal products including aluminum, stainless steel, carbon, related alloys, and mechanical grade plastics. **Hadco Metal** products include plate, sheet, and extensive offerings of long products for general engineering, aerospace, and commercial markets. Our range of precision cutting equipment includes waterjet, band saws, disc plate saws, and shears.

**Hadco Metal Trading** branches are located strategically in New York, Philadelphia, Connecticut, Florida, New Hampshire, North Carolina, Georgia, Oklahoma, Kansas, Texas, Arizona, Oregon, Washington, and California with transfer stations located throughout the East, Midwest and West allowing a nationwide presence and coverage with next day delivery capability.

**Work schedule:** **Sunday-Thursday 11:30PM-7:30AM.**

**Position Summary:**


Safely offload material such as stainless steel and aluminum plate, sheet, and bar stock from evening shuttles, and reload flatbed trucks for next day deliveries.

**Role & Responsibilities:**

* Safely operate forklift to offload material orders from overnight shuttles.
* Safely load completed orders onto flatbed trucks for next day deliveries.
* Assure that material is loaded for optimum delivery schedule.
* Assure that material is loaded without damage.
* Communicate with drivers daily.
* Scan material documents to maintain accurate inventory and shipping records.
* Utilize company ERP system for routing, inventory, and other necessary information.
* Comply with transportation-related policies, for proper distribution of weight per DOT and government regulations.
* Promote safe work activities and maintain a clean and safe work environment.


Requirements: **Minimum Requirements:**

* Ability to work overnight Sunday-Thursday 11:30PM-7:30AM.
* Commitment to report to work on time and as scheduled.
* Minimum two years of experience as a safe forklift operator in a distribution environment preferred.
* Basic computer skills.
* Knowledge of the transportation industry and logistics preferred.
* Critical thinking skills.
* Ability to lift 50 lbs. and climb on to truck beds as needed.
* Minimum 18 years of age.

**What Hadco Offers You:**

* Excellent hourly compensation
* Medical/dental/vision insurance
* Paid vacation, personal time, and holidays
* 401K with company match
* 100% paid life and disability insurance
* Uniforms and PPE provided at no cost to employees
* Safe and clean work environment
* Appreciation and respect for quality work and commitment to Hadco


Hadco is an Equal Opportunity Employer and does not discriminate against any employee or applicant for employment because of race, color, sex (including gender identity, sexual orientation or preference, and pregnancy), age, national origin, religion, disability or genetic information, marital status, status as a veteran, or any other federal, state, or local protected class or artificial barrier.

title: Associate Clinical Account Specialist- Long Island, NY - Johnson and Johnson (January 2025 Start Date)
description:
Johnson and Johnson, Inc. is recruiting for an Associate Clinical Account Specialist (ACAS), to be located in the Long Island, NY area.



At Johnson & Johnson, we believe health is everything. Our strength in healthcare innovation empowers us to build a world where complex diseases are prevented, treated, and cured, where treatments are smarter and less invasive, and solutions are personal. Through our expertise in Innovative Medicine and MedTech, we are uniquely positioned to innovate across the full spectrum of healthcare solutions today to deliver the breakthroughs of tomorrow, and profoundly impact health for humanity. Learn more at https://www.jnj.com/.

  

For more than 130 years, diversity, equity & inclusion (DEI) has been a part of our cultural fabric at Johnson & Johnson and woven into how we do business every day. Rooted in Our Credo, the values of DEI fuel our pursuit to create a healthier, more equitable world. Our diverse workforce and culture of belonging accelerate innovation to solve the world’s most pressing healthcare challenges. We know that the success of our business – and our ability to deliver meaningful solutions – depends on how well we understand and meet the diverse needs of the communities we serve. Which is why we foster a culture of inclusion and belonging where all perspectives, abilities and experiences are valued and our people can reach their potential. At Johnson & Johnson, we all belong.



Job Summary



The Associate Clinical Account Specialist (ACAS) position is a 6-9 month training position for those with little to no electrophysiology (EP) experience. Upon successful graduation from the program, the ACAS will be promoted to a Clinical Account Specialist (CAS). As a CAS the candidate will provide expert clinical product and technical assistance and training to physicians and EP lab staff on the effective use of BWI’s systems and catheter equipment (e.g., The CARTO® System, associated software modules and RF generator) during case procedures within an assigned geography. The expectation that is that this work leads to meeting and/or exceeding business goals.

  


The base salary for this position is $70,000.

  


The Company maintains highly competitive, performance-based compensation programs. Under current guidelines, this position is eligible for an annual performance bonus. The annual performance bonus is a cash bonus intended to provide an incentive to achieve annual targeted results by rewarding for individual and the corporation’s performance over a calendar/performance year. Bonuses are awarded at the Company’s discretion on an individual basis.

  


This position is eligible for a company car through the Company’s FLEET program.

  


Employees may be eligible to participate in Company employee benefit programs such as health insurance, savings plan, pension plan, disability plan, vacation pay, sick time, holiday pay, and work, personal and family time off in accordance with the terms of the applicable plans. Additional information can be found through the link below: https://www.careers.jnj.com/employee-benefits

  

Position Components



Under (e.g. limited supervision, general direction, etc.) and in accordance with all applicable federal, state and local laws/regulations and corporate Johnson & Johnson, procedures and guidelines, the ACAS will:

  

* Attend all portions of the ACAS fellowship training program without exception.
* Engage in dialogue with multiple internal and external business partners and stakeholders, and formulate solutions based on dialogue and input gained during training.
* Understand the dynamics of an EP lab, including, but not limited to physicians, nurses and technicians, clinical and hospital administrators and staff.
* Prioritize and appropriately respond to requests in a high-stress environment.
* Maintain composure and problem-solving focus during stressful interactions.
* Respond daily to requests by email and voicemail.
* Drive collaboration and maintain consistent, open lines of communication across the assigned responsibilities with the local team/Pod (i.e. TM and other CAS), as well as the support team (i.e. field trainers, site trainers, RBD) and other internal and external partners
* Responsible for following all company guidelines related to health, safety and environmental practices and that all resources needed to do so are available and in good condition.
* Responsible for adhering to company compliance with all federal, state, local and company regulations, policies, and procedures.

  

  

**Qualifications**
------------------


* A minimum of Bachelor’s degree is required by the hire date
* OR minimum of 2 years of related professional experience (engineering, or procedural hospital setting) is required with an Associate’s degree
* OR a minimum of 1 year of EP mapping experience with an Associate’s degree is required
* OR Graduate from an accredited academic program OR Industry prep school with a focus on EP with Bachelor’s degree is required
* OR exiting a branch of the US military with an Associate’s degree is required


\\*\\* Priority given to candidates with Bachelor’s or Master’s degree in one of the following fields:


* Biology
* Biochemistry
* Cardiac Function & Interventional Technology
* Chemistry: Polymers/Materials Science
* Computer Science
* Engineering: Biomedical, Computer Science, Chemical, Electrical, Mechanical, General Engineering
* Health Sciences
* Kinesiology
* Informatics and/or Data Science
* Pharmaceutical Science
* Physics
* Technical Design: Industrial Design/Product Design

  

  

* A valid driver’s license issued in the United States
* The ability to travel related to this role is required. Must be willing and able to travel up to 40% overnight locally, regionally, and nationally.
* Will be required to maintain advanced clinical knowledge of cardiac ablation and cardiac imaging, technical knowledge of EP technology, advancements, and the business landscape.
* Advance-level computer skills, and the ability to multitask without the direct oversight of manager required
* The ACAS will be hired for a specific company sales area and relocation to that pre-identified sales area after completion of the ACAS Training Program is required.
* Please note: For the ACAS role, we do not offer work visa sponsorships and we do not accept OPT/CPT

  

  

Johnson & Johnson is an Affirmative Action and Equal Opportunity Employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, age, national origin, or protected veteran status and will not be discriminated against on the basis of disability
